name: K2-254
scenarioDescription:
The K2-254 Exoplanetary System

K2-254 is a star with 0.71 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.67 times its radius. It is located 748.20 light years away from the solar system.

K2-254 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-254 b

K2-254 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.10 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-254.

The mass of K2-254 b is 3.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-254 b is 1.63 that of Earth. At 3.09 Earth masses, K2-254 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-254 c

K2-254 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.12 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-254.

The mass of K2-254 c is 6.28 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-254 c is 2.19 that of Earth. At 6.28 Earth masses, K2-254 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-254, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
